title: What's your favourite thing about summer?
self_text: Mine is the time I get to spend with my family!

title: First time driving a car
self_text: I’m turning 16 in about a month and I am so excited to finally drive my own car! I have been looking forward to this moment for a long time now and I cannot wait to feel the freedom of being able to drive myself wherever I want.  I know it’s only one step on the road to getting my license but still, I am really happy to be taking this step. Any advice from anyone who has driven before?

title: What’s your favorite video game?
self_text: I just started playing the new Zelda game and it’s amazing.

title: I’m having a really rough day at work…
self_text: Just wanted to vent for a bit. My manager is being incredibly rude to me today over a minor error in a report. He says he can’t believe I made such an obvious mistake, and then proceeded to spend the last half hour telling me how much more I need to improve. I’m exhausted from working long hours already, and his attitude just makes things worse. It's like he's trying to make me feel as bad about myself as possible.  I don’t know what to do.  Anyone else have similar experiences?

title: Ways to get my gf to be more comfortable with my gaming habits?
self_text: I’ve been playing games for a while now, but it seems like she doesn’t really understand why they’re so important to me. She says I spend too much time on them and thinks it makes me lazy. I know she just wants me to spend more time with her instead, which is fair enough, but she doesn’t seem to realize how vital these games are to my mental health and stress relief.  I don’t want to stop playing them entirely, but I do want to make her feel more included in my life. Any suggestions?

self_text: I am a beginner at chess so if possible please give me advice on how to improve my game.

self_text: I just saw it, what did you guys think?

title: I’m still grieving for my father
self_text: My father passed away last month. He was a really good man who always had time for me when I needed him. Now I can’t call him or talk to him ever again… I just miss him so much and feel like my heart is broken into pieces. I know I need to be strong for my mother, but I don’t know how I will get through it all without my dad. Does anyone else feel this way?

title: First time using a gaming pc
self_text: Just got my first gaming PC and it's amazing!!  What settings do you guys use on your games? I want to get the best performance but also have pretty graphics.  Also what kind of GPU/CPU do you guys recommend for someone who wants to play mostly single player games like cyberpunk 2077, doom eternal, etc.  I am currently running an RTX 3060 Ti and Ryzen 5 5600X.

title: I'm not a fan of the idea of being a single parent.
self_text: So my mom did not want me to have children. She said it would be too much for her. Now she is in a place where she can no longer do anything with me and has left me alone. I am very happy now but I still wish she was here.  I never thought about having children until I met my husband. He told me he wanted to adopt kids so we had to decide if we were ok with raising kids. Since I don't feel like doing that I told him I didn't want to raise any kids. He got upset because he loves me and wants a family. So he asked me why I don't want kids? I explained how I think it is important to raise them as a pair (parents). I also mentioned I don't want to take care of someone who doesn't want me around. We ended up arguing about it but ultimately decided to agree to disagree.  What do you all think? Should parents be a pair or should they be solo?

title: Is it okay if my dog likes the taste of my perfume?
self_text: I'm a female and like to wear perfume while I go out and work. My little guy loves the smell so much that he will come over when I spray on myself. Is that normal for dogs to like the smell of perfumes or colognes?

What if there's something wrong with them?

title: You’re a bad person
self_text: I just got out of an abusive relationship with someone who has committed crimes against me. They have not been punished for the things they did. I have filed a police report but the case was dropped because it wasn't my word against theirs.  I know what you think. That I am lying about them. That I am exaggerating. But I promise I am not.  They made threats against me, my family, and my friends. They destroyed my home, my car, and my life. They have spent the last few years trying to make me feel worthless and like I don't deserve to live. They are a monster and if I can warn anyone from going through what I went through, I will. Don’t be like them. Don’t hurt others.   If you are reading this and you have done something terrible to someone else, please seek help. There are people who care about you and want to see you change.  I love you all so much. Please be good to each other.

title: Did anyone else feel like they were being watched?
self_text: I’m just going to say it…I felt like someone was watching me today. I didn’t do anything wrong or anything out of the ordinary. Just went about my day as usual. But I just had this feeling that something was there looking at me.  It’s getting to me. I think I need to talk to someone about this.

title: What do you think about the whole AI thing?
self_text: I’ve been reading up on it lately, and honestly, it’s kind of scary. But also really exciting. Do you think we’ll ever get to a point where machines are actually intelligent? And if so, what would be the implications for humanity? Like, what happens when they can build better machines than us? Are we just going to become obsolete?  I feel like there’s no right or wrong answer here. Just different opinions.

title: AITA for not inviting my ex's new boyfriend?
self_text: My ex has a new boyfriend (we broke up 6 months ago) I didn’t want to see him or have anything to do with him but my mom wants me to go to his birthday party. He doesn't know about the break-up because she told me to not tell him.  I don't think it's right for her to invite me to his birthday party when she knows how much I hate him and don't want any contact with him. It’s like she's trying to force me to be in contact with someone I really hate. Is it rude to decline an invitation from my ex's boyfriend because of how bad things were between us?

title: Ways to get out of a toxic relationship
self_text: I’m currently in a toxic relationship with my husband. We have been together for 10 years and he has recently expressed his desire to divorce me. He says he wants to be single and date women younger than me.  I am so hurt and confused by what he has told me and want to get out of the relationship as soon as possible but don't know how to do it or where to start.  Can anyone give me advice on how to do this?

title: AITA for telling my husband I want a divorce?
self_text: So I've been with my husband for 10 years. We have two beautiful children together. We're not particularly wealthy but we're comfortable. We've had our ups and downs throughout the years, like any marriage, but recently things have taken a turn for the worse. We stopped communicating effectively months ago (if not longer). He has become increasingly rude and demeaning towards me in front of the kids and on social media. The last straw was when he told me that if I don't stop talking about wanting a divorce then he will take everything from me including the house and custody of the children. After much soul searching, I decided to move out and file for divorce. My husband did not react well to my decision, so now it's just a matter of time before he starts harassing me and potentially harming myself or my children.

title: What is your favorite quote?
self_text: This is just a fun little game! I will give my favourite quote first then I want everyone else to share theirs in the comments! Let’s see what we all have to say!

title: Ways to cope with a toxic relationship?
self_text: I’m in an abusive relationship for over 2 years now. He does not hit me physically but he hits me emotionally, verbally, gaslights me, manipulates me, controls me, makes me feel like I’m the problem when I don’t do what he wants, etc.  I have been trying to break free from him for so long now but every time I try to leave he tries to come up with excuses or promises or even threats. Does anyone have advice on how to get out of it without getting hurt again? I am scared of being alone as well. How can I start rebuilding my life? What should I do?

title: Ways to help someone with a mental health condition?
self_text: Hi all, I have a friend who has been struggling with depression for a while now. I want to be there for him, but don't know how best to do so. What are ways to help someone when they are suffering from mental health conditions? (Not to mention he doesn’t always talk about it which makes me feel like I can’t really ask if he needs help) Thanks in advance!

title: AITA for telling my husband he's being too kind?
self_text: My husband has been so incredibly nice lately - holding doors open, giving me a backrub when I was stressed, doing dishes (which he rarely does), etc. He's always been kind, but it's taken on an almost excessive level recently. I think he wants to be the perfect husband.  I said something to him like "You're being *too* nice".  He got really defensive and started saying how he just wanted to make me happy.  I told him I wasn't trying to hurt him and that I appreciate his kindness, but I don't want him to change who he is. He seems very confused and hurt by what I said. How do I explain this without hurting his feelings?

title: What’s a good way to start a conversation with someone I don’t know?
self_text: Is there something specific I should ask about them so they aren’t as likely to be uninterested in continuing the conversation?

title: I’m so confused by the concept of “the good place”
self_text: I watched a few episodes last night on Hulu because I was bored and it sounds like an interesting show. But I am genuinely confused by how it’s set up. Like, we know we are all in the good place now, but how did we get there? What criteria does the afterlife use? And why do people who were actively cruel or did something particularly evil seem to be getting better at being good? Why does someone like me (who never hurt anyone) end up here when I don't even know what it means to be a "good person"? Is there a certain kind of goodness they look for? Does everyone have different levels of goodness? How would that work?  It just seems like such a complex system.   I think the premise is good but the execution feels a little messy. Does anyone else feel this way?

Should I just give up?

title: I have a really weird feeling about my future.
self_text: I’m not sure if anyone else has ever felt like this before but the other day I was just sitting on the couch watching TV when suddenly this very intense feeling came over me. Like something really important is going to happen in the next few months. I don’t know what it is though. It’s like I can sense an event but I don’t know who or where it will be happening. The only thing I know for sure is that I should get ready for whatever it may be. I tried to think about what it could mean but nothing seems to come up. I’ve been doing a lot of meditation lately so maybe it’s just coming through during those sessions. I’ll keep you guys updated with how much I remember about the future.

title: How do I work out the best way to introduce myself?
self_text: This is a long post.  So, I'm an adult who has been single for most of my life. Now that I am older (30s), I'm starting to get into dating again. And I've come to realise how hard it can be for me to start conversations with people, let alone work out how to actually meet them in person! I have a number of interests (gaming, reading, learning languages, hiking, etc.) but no one seems to share any of those, which makes finding common ground tricky.  I'm not very good at flirting or doing anything "cool" like movie lines or picking up flowers, so I tend to just avoid meeting anyone new.   So, when I do find someone interesting (let's call them X) - whether online or in real life - what's the best approach to introducing yourself? Should I use social media? Texting? Or should I try to make contact through mutual friends? What if they don't respond? Should I keep trying?  And once I get their attention, how do I work out what they enjoy and what they're looking for in a relationship?  This feels like a huge mountain to climb, but I really want to get over my social anxiety and meet new people.   Thank you for your help!

title: What's your favourite thing about your pet?

title: AITA for asking my mom if I could get a boyfriend?
self_text: My mom was being super weird about me going out with friends lately so I asked her why she was acting like that. She said something along the lines of "You're too young" and "You don't need a boyfriend" but then she went on to say that if I wanted to date someone (which I do) then I should ask her what I thought about it, but only because she doesn't want me to be lonely in life and thinks it's important to have someone who cares about you. So basically she wants me to find a boyfriend but also doesn't think I should. Should I just accept her wishes or tell her that I'll figure it out myself?  AITA for asking my mom if I could get a boyfriend?

title: You ever feel like you're not the right person for someone?
self_text: Not the right person for them in life, but also not the right person for yourself either. Like I know they deserve better than me, and I know I don't deserve them. But it still hurts when I think about how good they would be with someone else. They should be with someone who has more confidence, more energy, and someone who doesn't get scared as easily.  I've been thinking a lot about this lately and I just wanted to see if anyone else has felt this way before. Maybe we can help each other through it.

title: My ex has a new boyfriend
self_text: So my ex and I broke up about six months ago and we were together for two years. She’s been seeing someone else since then but it’s only been a couple weeks or so.  Her new bf seems nice and he has a lot of respect for her and treats her well. They seem like they have good chemistry.  The thing is that when she was with me, she said she would never date someone who doesn’t know how to cook. But now that she is dating him she says that she likes that he can cook. I don’t know what to think about this. Is she just trying to get back at me? Should I be worried? Or am I overreacting? What do you guys think?

title: I am thinking about quitting my job
self_text: I have been working in a retail store for over three years now, at the age of 18 and then 19.  I recently got accepted into college, but it is not until next fall (so I will be 21). I am currently working a full time job so that I can save money for college.   The problem is that I hate this job.  I work in the back office, so I do not deal with customers as much. The only thing I do is make sure the inventory is accurate, and take orders from the front desk.  The pay is alright, but the job itself makes me want to cry sometimes.  I would like to quit my job so that I can focus on my studies, but I cannot afford to lose my income.  What should I do?

title: AITA for telling my friend she should not call me at night?
self_text: My friend has been calling me around 11pm-2am every night for the past few days. I’ve told her a couple times that I have work in the morning and can’t talk but she continues to do it anyway. She does not seem to understand how much sleep she needs and calls me multiple times during the night when I am trying to sleep.  I feel like I’m being harassed. What should I do?

title: Ways to talk to your parents about sex?
self_text: I’m 17 and my mom wants me to have a discussion with my dad about sex. He’s very closed off and doesn’t like talking about it at all. How can I talk to him about this in a way he will listen to?

title: AITA for being rude?
self_text: I was at the grocery store today, and a woman came up to me in line and said "I'm so sorry, but do you know if they have any almond milk?" I responded by saying "No" and kept walking.  She then got offended by my response and said I shouldnt be rude. She went on to say that I didn't need to get mad at her or anything. What am I supposed to say when someone asks something like that??

title: I can’t sleep without a pillow
self_text: Is it weird that I can only fall asleep with a pillow?

title: Can I get a refund?
self_text: So I bought a used phone from a guy on Craigslist for $100 (I got it for free). He said he had the box with all accessories and everything was in perfect working condition. When I received the phone, I noticed that there were scratches and scuffs and not a single accessory included. The battery life was also awful. And if I didn't notice these things, I would have been stuck with a faulty phone. The seller says he doesn't have the original box or any accessories, so I cannot ask him for a refund. Should I go to my local store? What should I do?

title: What do you think about the new trailer for Dune?
self_text: I’ve been waiting for a Dune movie for so long and it looks absolutely incredible! Did anyone else think the trailer looked amazing?

title: What’s your favourite movie?
self_text: I’m trying to figure out what to watch tonight, I’ve seen a lot but have been feeling like I don’t have anything new to watch.  What are some of your favourites?

title: First time using a dishwasher
self_text: I’ve always used my hand sink for washing dishes. My mother did it too, so I guess it’s in my blood. But tonight, I decided to use the dishwasher for the first time since moving into my own apartment (which is about 2 years now). I had no idea how much soap was needed! Like, seriously, there was a mountain of foam after everything was done. I didn’t know that dishwashers were so sensitive to soap. I’ll probably have to adjust things next time, but I thought I should share my experience with anyone else who may be considering doing something similar. Thanks!!

title: i hate how my friend always talks about his crush
self_text: he can’t stop talking about her. she is a girl in our class and he has been obsessed with her for months now. he asks her out every day and she says no. He keeps asking her out anyway.  I want to tell him to stop but I don’t know how. Does anyone have advice?

title: What’s a good first date idea for someone who hates going out?
self_text: I’m really trying to get over my anxiety and be social, but it’s hard when I just don’t want to go anywhere or do anything with anyone. Any ideas would be helpful!

title: How do I make friends in highschool?
self_text: So like i’m a freshman, and it’s so hard to make friends because most people already have groups that they hang out with.  I try to talk to people but usually it just ends up awkwardness and then they leave me alone.  How can I make friends?  And how does one become part of a group?
